bibl.title: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, 30 April 1940

div1.p: Clemons loans Hench a copy of Kelly's revised edition of "Walter Reed and Yellow Fever." He also offers to send photostats of two letters in the University of Virginia collection to him: Moran to Kean [August 28, 1939] and Kean to Clemons [September 22, 1939].

div1.head: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, 30 April 1940
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
30 April 1940
HARRY CLEMONS
LIBRARIAN
MARY LOUISE DINWIDDIE
ASSISTANT LIBRARIAN
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
A letter from Mr. John J. Moran
of Habana, Cuba, requests that the copy of the 1907
‘new and revised edition’ of Dr. Howard A. Kelly's
‘Walter Reed and Yellow Fever’ which he presented to
this Library be sent on loan to you. We are therefore
forwarding the book by prepaid express. The volume
comes from our rare book collection, and we are in-
suring it for twenty dollars. We shall be grateful
for word from you of its arrival.

Mr. Moran was of the opinion that you would
need the volume only for a few days. We are consequently
making this a loan for two weeks, and we hope that this
will be satisfactory to you.

We have in our files two rather long auto-
graph letters, one from Mr. Moran (dated 28 August 1939)
addressed to Gen. Jefferson Randolph Kean and one from
General Kean (dated 22 September 1939) addressed to me,
which discuss at some length the parts played by Dr.
Walter Reed and by Dr. Carlos J. Finley in the conquest
of yellow fever. If you should be interested in these,
we can lend to you photoprint copies. General Kean,
like Mr. Moran, wrote from personal experience. His
address is 2804 N Street, N. W., Georgetown, Washington,
D. C., and for any special use of his letter you would
need to obtain his permission.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Harry Clemons
Librarian To Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
